content.description:
Start with hands matched on a good low lip.  Throw high to a good left hand jug.  In the beta photo, I have marked the jug with an "X".  After that, bring your right to a crimp.  Grab a knob for your left, and then go for the jugs on top of the boulder.

Whether the good ledges below the main portion of the boulder are on or not is debatable.  This problem would be possible if you avoided the low ledge, but making the big throw would be very, very difficult.  You might be able to find some intermediate holds to avoid the throw and thereby avoid using the low ledge, but I think those variation would also be much more difficult.  If you crush, then by all means, destroy my wimpy ledge-using beta.
content.protection: Pads and spotters.  The landing under this problem has some large ankle-rolling rocks sticking out of the ground.  Fall gracefully if you must fall.
content.location: This problem is on the northwest prow of the Forgotten Block.

content.description:
Start on positive holds on the northwest corner and move up via jugs and heel hooks.

If you use the rocks underneath the boulder, it becomes quite a bit easier, so we tried to avoid that.
content.location: The northwest corner is where you'll see the problem. Again, there's lots of potential for more and has probably seen lots of action, just not a lot of publicity.

content.description: Start with hands matched on a good low ledge and a right heel on.  Pull up to another good ledge, match, then go one more time.  By now you should be high enough rock your weight over onto your right foot.  Stand up and top out.
content.location:
This is to the right of

Forget Me Not

on the west face of the Forgotten Block.

content.description:
Start with hands matched on an incut lip.  Bring your right up into a good dish, and gaston to the left to catch a good crimp.  Upgrade your right to a nice crimp at the bottom of a seam.  Stand up and grab the top jugs.  Finish in the "U".

Once again, some may say the lower ledge is off for feet.  If that were the case for this problem, I'm not sure it would be doable anymore.  If it were doable without the low ledge, it would be V-hard most likely.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter.  There are large ankle-rollers sticking out of the ground under the problem, and there is a small boulder you could tumble backward into if you landed wrong.  A good spotter will greatly mitigate those risks.
content.location: This problem starts underneath the northeast prow of the Forgotten Block.  Look for the black streak up the north face of the boulder.  You pretty much climb along that streak.
